background: The problem focuses on finding an optimal trading strategy that involves deciding on the quantity of goods to buy and sell each month, considering storage capacity and associated costs.
constraints: The amount of goods held in storage must be non-negative
The amount of goods sold in each period must be non-negative
The amount of goods bought in each period must be non-negative
The amount of goods stored must not exceed the maximum storage capacity, Capacity
objective: Maximize the total profit over the months from buying and selling goods
description: Determine the amount of buying and selling in each period to maximize the profit over the months, given the constraints of maximum storage \param{Capacity}, holding costs \param{HoldingCost}, selling prices \param{Price}, and buying costs \param{Cost}.

parameters.definition: Cost of holding one unit of product
Cost of buying in each period
